Articles.Content:
This may already be on the forums somewhere but I didnt see it. So I'm just going to hang this here... [http://www.space.com/30137-dizzying-up-and-down-rocket-flight-captured-by-on-board-cam-video.html](http://www.space.com/30137-dizzying-up-and-down-rocket-flight-captured-by-on-board-cam-video.html)

Enjoy!

Love the yoyo despin!

BTW, does anybody have a guess what would be the cost of such a rocket (few kg payload ~250 km suborbital)?
That was spectacular. Why does the rocket spin at all to begin with?

It's for stabilization.

Fins only work in atmosphere so they spin the rocket up to keep the pointy end up once it reaches vacuum. Bullets work the same way.
